title: Nature Loss Can Hurt Our Safety and Food
summary: A new report says that when nature gets sick, it can make the UK less safe and prosperous. The report was made by a group that looks at security risks. It warns that if important places like rainforests and coral reefs collapse, it could cause problems like fights over resources, people moving to new places, and higher food prices. The UK gets a lot of food from other countries, so if those places have trouble, we might not have enough food or it could cost more. The report lists six key areas around the world that are very important for the UK's safety. The government says this report will help them plan for the future to keep people safe and healthy.

background_read: This article is about a report from a security group in the UK. It explains that when nature is damaged, like forests or oceans dying, it can cause big problems for countries. For kids aged 8-10, it's important to know that taking care of nature helps keep us safe and ensures we have enough food to eat. The report talks about places far away, like the Amazon rainforest, that affect us here because we rely on them for things like food.
Article_Structure: WHO: A security group called the Joint Intelligence Committee made the report.
WHAT: The report warns that nature loss can hurt the UK's safety and food supply.
WHERE: It focuses on the UK and important ecosystems around the world like the Amazon.
WHY: To alert people and the government so they can plan to protect nature and keep everyone safe.

perspectives.description: The report sees nature loss as a risk to national safety, like causing conflicts or food shortages.
